overview: Career Development Loans are low interest loans to pay for courses and training that help with your career - eligibility, and repayments and interest
title: Career Development Loans

table.body:
Career Development Loans are bank loans to pay for courses and training that help with your career or help get you into work.

You can borrow between £300 and £10,000. 

Loans are usually offered at a reduced interest rate and the government pays some of the interest. 

##How to apply

s1. Order an application pack.
s2. Fill in the application form and send it to your bank.
s3. Your bank will decide if you qualify for a loan.
s4. You take out the loan with your bank and agree to their repayment conditions.

You can order an application pack from Next Step.

$C**Next Step**

0800 100 900  
[Email Next Step](https://nextstep.direct.gov.uk/Contactus/emailanadviser/Pages/default.aspx "Send a message to a Next Step career adviser"){:rel="external"}$C

You should apply 3 months before your course starts to give the bank enough time to process your application.

^Check with your benefits office before you take out a loan as it can affect the benefits you're entitled to.^
table.title: Overview

table.body:
##Who can apply

To apply you must:

- be 18 or over
- have been living in the UK for at least 3 years before your course starts
- plan to work in the UK, European Union (EU) or European Economic Area (EEA) after the course 

##Which courses qualify?

Courses must:

- only last up to 2 years, or 3 years if they include 1 year of work experience
- be provided by an organisation on the Professional Career and Development Loan Register - check with your course provider
- help with your career - they don't have to lead to a qualification

You can't get Career Development Loans for first full-time degrees but you can [apply for student finance.](/apply-for-student-finance-2012-13 "Apply for student finance 2012/13")

*[EU]: European Union
*[EEA]: European Economic Area
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
##Interest on the loan
Career Development Loans are bank loans that have to be paid back. You start repaying the loan (plus interest) 1 month after leaving your course.  

Interest is charged on your loan, currently the typical rate is 9.9% a year. It starts from the time you get your first payment until you pay back your loan in full.

The government pays the interest while you study and for 1 month after you leave your course. After this time, you start repaying the loan and interest. 

^You have to repay your loan even if you don't complete the course or your course provider goes out of business.^
